Installation of the CITE (Compilation Information Through Emacs) compiler tool prototype

1. Download CITE over the Web

  1. CITE would have been installed in /usr/lib/cite

2. Modifying .emacs

If you dont have a .emacs file then you can copy the sample file from the XEmacs distribution and make the changes suggested below:
cp /usr/gnu/lib/xemacs-19.13/etc/sample.emacs ~/.emacs

You will also need to modify your .emacs file to load CITE. You will need to copy the following elisp code to the end of your .emacs file. 

(if (and (string-match "XEmacs" emacs-version)
       (boundp 'emacs-major-version)
       (= emacs-major-version 19)
       (>= emacs-minor-version 12))
    (progn
      (set-default-toolbar-position 'left)
      (add-spec-list-to-specifier top-toolbar-height '((global (nil . 0))))
      (add-spec-list-to-specifier bottom-toolbar-height '((global (nil . 0))))
      (add-spec-list-to-specifier left-toolbar-width '((global (nil . 37))))
      (add-spec-list-to-specifier right-toolbar-width '((global (nil . 0))))
      (load-file "/usr/lib/cite/xemacs-elisp/cite.elc")))

The above elisp code loads CITE only when you are running XEmacs version greater than or equal to 19.12. It also sets the toolbar to be on the left side. If you are using GNU Emacs then the following also makes sure that you can use the same .emacs file under both GNU Emacs and XEmacs. It isolates the loading of CITE to be only under XEmacs.
